intro: Hibiscus gilletii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, typically blooming in summer. The plant has dark green, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to arid environments with its deep root system. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Hibiscus gilletii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
